Because it is not known how much the market will be in such a state, and it is not known how long they intend to wait.  These are the latest updates from the team:   Dear Community, weÂ´d love to provide you with an update regarding what happened in the past weeks. Tech Development: our development team worked very hard and we are making very good progress. We are strongly improving the existing survey solution based on a lot of feedback that we receive from our existing customers.   This will lead to more sustainability and an increase in the number of customers. Besides strengthening the existing product solution we are further working on our web-eye tracking and web-emotion recognition solution. We plan to provide you a great video that shows the capability of the current prototype early year.    Regarding listing and exchanges: we do have listing agreements signed with 5 exchanges so far including high ranked exchanges on CMC and Coinhills. Besides that we have a powerful listing strategy and campaign prepared that we will execute once the crypto market gets friendlier.  Since itÂ´s Christmas and New Year time here in Europe our team will be on vacation in the next two weeks. We do all wish you a merry Christmas and happy, healthy and successful new year 2019!

Author: DeViL303
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: PDATA to Develop Personal Data Trading Platform based on Blockchain  PDATA, a Germany-based blockchain project that builds a personal data trading platform, is planning to raise USD 30m to further improve its existing market and consumer research platform Opiria, CEO Christian Lange said during the interview.         Opiria is a consumer data platform that allows companies to better understand the needs and requirements of each customers and to generate better services and products, Lange said, adding that the platform already has a number of users from Fortune 500 companies, including Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Audi, Volkswagen, GM, Nissan Intel, and Procter&Gamble.  PDATA is aiming at building the blockchain-based data trading platform between consumers and corporates, via using its ERC20 token PDATA.  PDATAâs new platform will be secured and in line with General Data Protection Regulation(GDPR)  guideline, Lange note https://tokennews-hk.com/news/pdata-to-develop-personal-data-trading-platform-in-blockchain/

Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Here's the message ChristianLange stated earlier, "Regarding postponing the end of the public sale: we discussed this thoroughly with our advisors and partners to find the best solution in the current market situation in which the overall attitude is negative. The vast majority advised us to postpone since listing in the current market situation would be a "bloodbath" (as it is for almost every ICO right now). Since we are interested in the longterm success and not just in a not sustainable short term gain we decided to postpone the end of the sale. We are strongly convinced that this was the best solution for everyone involved. I hope I was able to explain to you why we decided to do it that way. We hope this for the better because FUD is kicking for this project all of a sudden.

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey there! A very reasonable question. now to answer that, PDATAâs trading of personal data is based on the blockchain. Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Hope this clarifies all the air around it

Author: BestKait
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello there, that's a good question!  The Opiria Platform was created as a response to an established desire amongst consumers to have greater control over their personal data, and keep it secure. Further, there are now very strict laws about data collection and distribution that must be followed according to the EU - the platform works within these regulations, which are not optional but real laws that must be complied with.  The platform will be easy enough to use that gaining an income from selling your data will be truly passive - very little effort for some extra cash!  We believe this is a pretty compelling offer, as do all of our supporters.

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello Psoo7, sorry for the late response. Here's an update pertaining your question:  The consumer can choose any time to delete all his data that is stored on the opiria platform. For the data that has been exchanged for PDATA tokens with companies, the process is as follows: the consumers are well informed to whom they give the data and what is the intended purpose of usage of this data, as well as the usage period. If the consumer agrees to this, he gets the PDATA tokens in return and the data is handed over to the company that bought it. All this is happening through the blockchain and explained into more detail here: https://medium.com/pdata-token/enabling-gdpr-compliant-trading-of-personal-data-on-the-blockchain-2086e7585be0. There is no undo function on the blockchain. The company gets the data and can use it and the consumer gets the PDATA tokens. We might think of a possibility of revoking the contract, case in which the tokens get back to the company and the company agrees not to use the data. But this cannot be ensured through the blockchain since the company already has the data of the user.  Hope this helps answer your question

Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA

Author: Vinal1953
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Here you go!  How does it work? The process is very simple:  1.Register for the PDATA token sale under this link by filling out the registration form. 2.After submitting the registration we are verifying the provided information, performing KYC and AML checks and verifying if the country of residence allows you to contribute. Within 24 hours we are sending you an email informing if your registration was accepted. 3.After receiving the email that you are accepted for the PDATA token sale, go to your contribution page by clicking the Contribute button on the https://opiria.io site or following this link: https://opiria.io/contribute 4.On the contribution page you will see the status of your registration, the address to send the contribution amount to and at the bottom of the page, the Referral information (see image below). 5.Copy the Referral URL and send it to your friends. When clicking on the referral link your friends will be directed to the project website where they can also register and contribute. 6.For each friend that contributed from your referral link you and your friend as well will get 5% extra tokens according to the contribution amount. The number of bonus tokens and the number of referred contributors are displayed in the Referral Information area of your contribution page.

Author: Ealaings
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi guys! How does the Opiria web application work?

Author: Pered1980
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi Ealanigs! The Opiria web application is the central platform that allows companies to create, distribute and analyze surveys.

Author: Ealaings
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Thank you for the answer! But could you maybe give me/us an example?

Author: Duche1976
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: I can help with that: Companies doing research on the platform create a survey, select the appropriate consumer profile from the Opiria database (e.g. gender: male, age: 40-50 years old, country: USA and China) and distribute the survey to the target consumer profile. The consumers receive the survey in real-time on their smartphone together with a notification. If you were looking for an example of survey, I can't help you with that.

Author: Pered1980
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: I don't understand what example you need? A model of the survey? I don't have one, but it should be a normal survey...

Author: Milethave
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: What kind of surveys do we have to do?

Author: Duche1976
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Currently, two types of surveys are supported: mobile surveys and mobile diaries. A mobile survey contains one or several questions and is answered once. A mobile diary can be answered multiple times and tracks consumer experiences with a product or a service for a certain period of time.

Author: BestKait
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey Ealaings, lots of good stuff here!  Just to give you a better picture of what this will look like I'll provide a few more details.  Surveys are one great way to use the platform. Of course, we cannot give you a reference of what this would look like, as these will be tailor-made by the companies to suit their needs. But beyond this, companies will be able to request all sorts of personal data, particularly your browsing history, but they can also incorporate emotional response data, collected through cameras.  All of this will be stipulated in an agreement between the company and the consumer, and the consumer retains their privacy in compliance with GDPR regulations.  I hope this helps!

Author: DeViL303
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Discussing Personal DataâââThe Oil of The 21st CenturyâââWith Nasdaq    The Opiria platform and PDATA token are creating a global decentralized marketplace for the secure and transparent buying and selling of personal data.  Opiria and PDATA will democratize the brokerage of personal data in a secure, lawful, fair and transparent way, by making use of blockchain technology and the principle of choiceâââyour choice to securely sell your personal data to any interested companies you want to, with the help of the Opiria platform.  As such, Opiria enables consumers to create a passive income stream by monetizing their personal data and will connect consumers and companies globally and become the worldâs largest decentralized personal data marketplace. Companies can buy personal data directly from consumers and compensate them with PDATA Tokensâââthe currency that expresses the value of personal data and enables its trading by using smart contracts on the blockchain.  Companies benefit by gaining access to real, reliable and high-quality consumer data and compensate consumers for their data with PDATA tokens; all the while respecting their privacy, in line with rigorous General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) guidelines.  Currently, weâre in our pre-sale which will end June 15th, 2018, with a minimum entry of 2,500 USD and a bonus of 20%. The public sale will begin June 16th, 2018 and run until July 14th, 2018, having no minimum entry and a bonus of 15% on day one, decreasing by 1% each day until the bonus is exhausted. https://medium.com/pdata-token/discussing-personal-data-the-oil-of-the-21st-century-with-nasdaq-6c9eb822cd40

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey Ealaings,  That's majorly why Opiria is blockchain based.  Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello Caremen4468, Opiria&PDATA is a Global decentralized marketplace for the secure and transparent buying and selling of personal data made in Germany. Major breakthrough by directly connecting companies and consumers and enabling a direct exchange of personal data.  Opiria-Platform enables consumers to create a passive income stream by monetizing their personal data. Companies can buy personal data directly from consumers to understand their needs and requirements and to design better products and services. PDATA Token is the currency for trading personal data using smart contracts on the blockchain.  Itâs not elegant to talk about other projects, However let me point out our salient features. We already have a working product with existing renowned customers such as Mercedes, BMW, Audi and GM. The platform we propose is already in use with all clients, minus the blockchain element. In addition to that our platform is designed to be fully compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation.  Opiria is the first and only platform that brings together detailed consumer profiling, subjective feedback & opinions from consumers and data from many important objective channels (e.g. web browsing, eye tracking, emotions, data from wearables and smart devices, smartphone usage, online shopping and more). This approach provides companies with the data and insights they need. Only the combination of objective and subjective data and a precise consumer profile makes personal data valuable!

Body: Hi guys! I have a friend looking to invest in PDATA, and he asked me what are the steps that he will need to take to get the tokens. So i looked it up on the whitepaper and this is what i found:  â Register to the Opiria platform with the Opiria app or the Opiria web interface for consumers. â Fill out initial survey and disclose basic necessary personal data (demographics). â Fill out additional surveys regarding different topics such as interests, education, financial data, health data and so on. â Install Opiria app on smartphone (if not already installed) and define which personal data shall be disclosed (e.g. smartphone usage, app usage and data, browsing behavior, touchscreen entries, online shopping behavior, emotion tracking, location tracking, data from connected wearables, data from connected smart devices, and so on). â Install Opiria browser plug-in and define which personal data shall be disclosed (e.g. browsing behavior, keyboard entries, online shopping behavior, screen recording, eye tracking, emotion tracking, give access to social networks, give access to contacts, and so on).

Author: thedon1997
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Thank you Yeyz for the Kind words.  Opiria's CEO Christian Lange founded his first company named Ergoneers GmbH in 2005.  There he developed a data acquisition and analysis platform called D-Lab, aimed towards the objective analysis of human behavior, supporting many different sensors and inputs. D-Lab became and still is an industry standard in the automotive industry, is used by automotive OEMs, Universities and Research Institutes worldwide and big companies like Microsoft, Intel, Google, Apple, Nokia, Samsung, P&G and Nestle. All together D-Lab has 1000+ customers worldwide. Christian also grew a worldwide sales partner network with sales partners in more than 20 different countries.  Opiria's CTO Marlene Gagesch was head of software development at Ergoneers and helped growing the D-Lab software to an industry standard. She and also a part of the former developer team with experience in data aggregation and analysis are now building up Opiria and PDATA.  As you can see the team has a lot of experience and working very hard to make this project a success

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Good question! Opiria is the first and only platform that brings together detailed consumer profiling, subjective feedback & opinions from consumers and data from many important objective channels (e.g. web browsing, eye tracking, emotions, data from wearables and smart devices, smartphone usage, online shopping and more). This approach provides companies with the data and insights they need. Other projects only focus on few objective channels (mostly social media) and neglect subjective opinions and consumer profiling.  Only the combination of objective and subjective data and a precise consumer profile makes personal data valuable!

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello all , Not at all, Actually , this bolsters the need for moer security. PDATAâs trading of personal data is based on the blockchain. Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Also , in light of this discussion there was an article on BV world e-magazine titled "Business Vision â Spring 2018". Where Mark Zuckerberg and our CEO, Christian Lange are on the same page !!  Here is the link for it ð  https://bv.world/magazine/  On page 48 -49

In the existing market, personal data is often obtained through dishonest practices, and consumers are not compensated. Opiria wants to fix this, so that as you go about your online activity, not only is your information safely in your control but that you additionally have the opportunity to generate income from it.   I hope this answers your question!

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey there , to address your concern ,as I understand the company doesn't try to force people to join, the concept behind the company is to motivate the consumers to provide authentic personal information voluntarily. This is achieved by discounting the middleman involved in the regular format of the industry. The companies pays directly to the consumers for their data they provide, hence generating  a passive income to the consumer. Plus since the companies have to pay via PDATA , they need to acquire the tokens to buy the data from the consumers , hence creasing a demand and supply routine. So the tokens also in turn contribute to motivate people to join  Hope this answers

Body: As noted in the whitepaper, personal data is the oil of the 21st century. Data brokerage is a 250 billion USD/year industry, the data brokerage industry grew by 13.5% in the past 4 years and is expected to grow at the same rate during the next few years.

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Opiria's CEO Christian Lange founded his first company named Ergoneers GmbH in 2005.  There he developed a data acquisition and analysis platform called D-Lab, aimed towards the objective analysis of human behavior, supporting many different sensors and inputs. D-Lab became and still is an industry standard in the automotive industry, is used by automotive OEMs, Universities and Research Institutes worldwide and big companies like Microsoft, Intel, Google, Apple, Nokia, Samsung, P&G and Nestle. All together D-Lab has 1000+ customers worldwide. Christian also grew a worldwide sales partner network with sales partners in more than 20 different countries.  Opiria's CTO Marlene Gagesch was head of software development at Ergoneers and helped growing the D-Lab software to an industry standard. She and also a part of the former developer team with experience in data aggregation and analysis are now building up Opiria and PDATA.  https://opiria.io/#team

Author: thedon1997
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey Leekhanh197,  PDATA is a global decentralized marketplace for the secure and transparent buying and selling of personal data made in Germany. A major breakthrough by directly connecting companies and consumers and enabling a direct exchange of personal data.  Opiria-Platform enables consumers to create a passive income stream by monetizing their personal data. Companies can buy personal data directly from consumers to understand their needs and requirements and to design better products and services. PDATA Token is the currency for trading personal data using smart contracts on the blockchain.

Author: BestKait
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi Fromastlese,  That's a really good question!  While it may seem this way at first, what you have to remember about the Opiria-platform, is that rather than an intermediary service, like a data broker, the platform is rather a tool to equip its users to facilitate their own transactions.  Whatever operating fees are associated with the transactions will be minimal, and instead of crooked data brokers profiting from consumer's personal data, the consumer is the direct recipient of that income  The interface of the app is an enabler, putting the consumer in a fair position to authorize how they want their data used, allows them to generate a passive income, and devalues the product of brokers violating personal privacy  .  I hope this answers your question.

Author: BestKait
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi Hoge1934,  You can begin by checking out the existing Opiria apps. What's so great about this project, is that it is already on the road and experiencing great success in its present form! The nature of Opiria's vision is primed to be well adapted as a blockchain technology, where the decentralization, privacy, and cost-effectiveness will allow the platform to serve users even better and make the service more accessible!  Here is a link to the apps to make it easy: https://opiria.io/#app  Thanks for your support  .

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Opiriaâs Lange Introduces PDATA Token to the World  The token presale starts April 20th.  Dr. Christian Lange conducted a global tour of cryptocurrency events to introduce the world to his blockchain platform Opiria and its PDATA Token.  âYou might have heard of the term that personal data is the oil of 21st Century,â Lange told an audience at the Gibraltar International FinTech Forum 2018 ( GibFin) on February 27 and 28, 2018. âThe reason for this is that companies all around the world need that personal data. Today data brokers are making big money with our personal data.â  Lange is the CEO and founder of Opiria, a German-based firm that buys consumer data from individuals and markets it to Big Business. The tour is designed to promote Opiriaâs presale offering for its PDATA token, which is scheduled to begin on April 20, 2018. PDATA is an Ethereum-based cryptocurrency designed to monetize consumersâ personal data.  Read more: https://coinidol.com/opiria-lange-introduces-pdata-token/

Body: what makes your project different and special ?

Author: Zye
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello Flysohigh.noshy. That is a good question. I personally believe that the benefits that the consumer receives are just one of the main features of the PDATA platform that makes it different:  Consumers will have full control over the collection and usage of their personal data. Consumers can control with whom they share their personal data. Consumers get proper compensation for the provided personal data. Personal data flows directly from consumers to companies with no middleman  Beyond the consumer, it is the Tech that PDATA are moving towards that is special. With version 2.0 the PDATA platform will also allow researchers to run web browser based surveys. The Opiria eye tracking browser plugin will measure consumer's gaze behavior when looking at stimuli (e.g. videos or pictures: embedded in a survey or when browsing the internet, playing games or interacting with software. At the same time the Opiria emotion analysis browser plugin will measure consumer emotions by looking at their facial expressions.

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello there Thimpare, aside the fact that this project relies on blockhain, all users data are kept in an encrypted state. This puts data in a more or less redundant state and guess what? Only the user has the key to decrypt the data. Again, consent of user is sought before all data exchange transactions are initiated. What's more, transaction is carried directly between user and company.  We know that data isn't corrupt as consumers are very well aware they're are going to be incentivized with tokens for releasing data and again, they release data at their own free will.  Most data brokers don't seek consent of personal data owners before trading their data which means data owners don't get compensated for their traded data.  PDATA on their other hand makes sure data trading is carried out directly between user and company. User can choose to release his data or not upon receiving a request from a company. Most amazing part is consumers are rewarded with PDATA tokens which can be traded for fiat currency like USD for selling their data.

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello Nourins, PDATA as a utility token, PDATA tokens are not investment products. Rather, PDATA token serve a specific function within the Opiria Platform Software and PDATA ecosystem, which is the means to access and purchase active energy at a lower cost. Without PDATA token, the general public may not access the PDATA token system.  There is also no expectation of future profit or gain from the acquisition of PDATA token. For these and other reasons, we believe the sale of PDATA token does not constitute a public offering of securities subject to prospectus registration requirements.

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello , Good question, let me explain. Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Hope this solves your question

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi karrpalex!  It can be one of the following:  â¢ Personal information (like demographics, financial, health data) â¢ Opinions and feedback (from using different products and services or direct opinion on different topics) â¢ How you browse the internet, what sites you are visiting â¢ What you buy online â¢ How you use our mobile devices â¢ Data from smart devices (like smart home, smart scale, intelligent toothbrush, etc.) â¢ Data from wearables (like smart watches and other health devices) â¢ Eye tracking data (to analyze what is being seen and what not on a website, an advertisement an so on) â¢ Emotions (to know what is the mood of the consumer while looking at a website, a commercial video, etc.)  I would like to add that consumers have full control of their data and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it so the data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent.   Please watch this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKY0J6omPvA

Author: kieran_84
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: To add to the great response from Felicisimoiii above ð  Currently, two types of surveys are supported: mobile surveys and mobile diaries. A mobile survey contains one or several questions and is answered once. A mobile diary can be answered multiple times and tracks consumer experiences with a product or a service for a certain period of time.

Author: S3cco
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Bitcoin Garden: Blockchain Project Opiria Invites Users to Sell Personal Data, Introduces PDATA Token https://bitcoingarden.org/blockchain-project-opiria-invites-users-to-sell-personal-data-introduces-pdata-token/  âData is clearly the new oil,â â Jonathan Taplin, director emeritus of the USC Annenberg Innovation Lab and author of Move Fast and Break Things: How Facebook, Google, and Amazon Cornered Culture and Undermined Democracy.  Personal data matters a lot. Itâs not just what you searched for, where you were, what you shared, what you bought âitâs a record of who you are. This is valuable information that can either work for you, or work for companies that collect it.  Data brokerage is a $250 billion per year industry and itâs grown 13.5% over the last four years. This is because itâs the resource that fuels the digital economy. Internet behemoths routinely track your online activities and sell this data to third parties youâre not aware of.  Most of these practices serve legitimate purposes. Data is the way companies see the world. They use it for insights into how to build better products and improve customer relations, benefiting consumers as well as their bottom line. However, there is no real need for any intermediaries to be in the business of profiting from your personal information....

Author: BestKait
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi, I hope this offers you some clarity on the encryption security protocol that will be used in the Opiria-Platform.  Opiriaâs concept is to store cleartext information of just proof of the existence of data, as well as some information about the data. The platform cannot access the personal data of the consumers by itself. It can only access profile information of the consumers. That enables companies to filter for consumer profiles and datasets they are interested in.  The question of where the data is stored then arises. The original unencrypted data never leaves the storage of its owner, that is usually the device on which the data was sourced (e.g. the userÂ´s smartphone). Whenever data has to leave this device, it is encrypted.  You can keep up to date on new developments by joining the Telegram announcement channel: https://t.me/PDATAannouncements

Author: kieran_84
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: We already have a working product with existing renowned customers such as Mercedes, BMW, Audi and GM. The platform we propose is already in use with all clients, minus the blockchain element. In addition to that our platform is designed to be fully compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation. In contrast to that Datum and DataWallet don't have a customer base and a working product.  Opiria is the first and only platform that brings together detailed consumer profiling, subjective feedback & opinions from consumers and data from many important objective channels (e.g. web browsing, eye tracking, emotions, data from wearables and smart devices, smartphone usage, online shopping and more). This approach provides companies with the data and insights they need. Datum and DataWallet only focus on few objective channels (mostly social media) and neglect subjective opinions and consumer profiling.  Only the combination of objective and subjective data and a precise consumer profile makes personal data valuable!

Author: kieran_84
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: The General Data Protection Regulation regulates how businesses have to protect personal data and privacy of EU citizens. The GDPR is valid for transactions within EU member states but it also regulates how to export personal data outside the EU. The GDPR is consistent across all EU member states what means that companies only have to implement the standard once.  The GDPR is binding for any company that stores or processes personal data or information about EU citizens within the EU states even if they don't have a business presence in the EU. âPersonal dataâ means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.  How Opiria fulfills the requirements of GDPR:  The following points are ways the Opiria-platform fulfills the GDPR requirements regarding privacy and protection of personal data.  1. Consent as lawful basis for processing  2 . Security of processing and pseudonymisation  3. Right of access, transparency and processing purpose  4. Right to rectification, to erasure and data portability  5. Records of processing activities  6. Data protection by design and by default  You can read in detail about these points in the whitepaper: https://opiria.io/static/docs/Opiria-PDATA-Whitepaper.pdf

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi there! That's an interesting way to look at this. The company already has a working product minus the blockchain element ,however there are reasons and advantages to using the blockchain.  Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Hope this answers your question

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey Magisterr Opiria platform is a Global decentralized marketplace for the secure and transparent buying and selling of personal data. We basically believe in directly connecting companies and consumers and enabling a direct exchange of personal data. Companies can buy personal data directly from consumers to understand their needs and requirements and to design better products and services. Opiria-Platform also enables consumers to create a passive income stream by monetizing their personal data.  PDATA Token is the currency for trading personal data using smart contracts on the blockchain. All transactions on the Opiria platform are paid for with PDATA tokens.  Mercedes, BMW, Audi and GM, to name a few are part of our existing customers.  You can take time to read our Whitepaper to more details here;https://opiria.io/  You can also join our telegram group for live chat and updates here;https://t.me/PDATAtoken

Author: kieran_84
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: The PDATA token ecosystem consists of consumers and companies, facilitating a two-sided token economy. Companies can purchase personal data directly from consumers by compensating them with PDATA tokens.  Consumers receive PDATA tokens for providing personal data to companies. Consumers can decide which personal data they disclose and who gets access to it. Due to blockchain mechanisms consumer's anonymity and data privacy is fully protected.  Companies get quick and easy access to personal data from consumers by compensating them with PDATA tokens. Companies receive more specific data of higher quality and will be able to make the right decisions when designing new products and services as well as to better target marketing and sales activities.  The Opiria platform is a fully transparent open marketplace for the secure trading of personal data without any middleman. The PDATA token puts value in personal data and creates a currency that exactly expresses their value.  This video explains this process:  https://youtu.be/uKY0J6omPvA

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hey , that's an interesting question. let me explain. PDATAâs trading of personal data is based on the blockchain. Blockchains were built to function in a âtrust lessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Hope this answers your question ð

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Thank you ð. I would also add to point out , In order to get consumers into our platform we have different approaches that work together simultaneously: -   Consumers via our customers: our customers invite their customers to join our database; a nice example of this is what happened with one our customers Freightliner: they invited 2000 truck drivers to join our database to provide data and feedback about how they are using the Freightliner trucks -   AirDrop campaign: after the ICO we start an AirDrop campaign; that means new users of our app receive an initial compensation (in PDATA tokens) for signing up -   Referrals: existing users can invite other users and receive a referral fee (PDATA tokens) if the invited ones sign up -   ICO community: our goal is to have about 15,000 members in our community (we already have 2,500); we will make all of them download our Opiria app and we ask them to invite friends and families as well; we are about to start with an âopinion of the day surveyâ to send interesting questions to our community every couple days. Afterwards they receive an email with the results of the survey -   Social media marketing: this is the classical social media marketing with paid ads; the costs for those campaigns are already planned in our financial plan.

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hi there , Datum and Datawallet are our competitors, but we are a lot different from them. We already have a working product with existing renowned customers such as Mercedes, BMW, Audi and GM. The platform we propose is already in use with all clients, minus the blockchain element. In addition to that our platform is designed to be fully compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation. In contrast to that Datum and DataWallet donÂ´t have a customer base and a working product. Opiria is the first and only platform that brings together detailed consumer profiling, subjective feedback & opinions from consumers and data from many important objective channels (e.g. web browsing, eye tracking, emotions, data from wearables and smart devices, smartphone usage, online shopping and more). This approach provides companies with the data and insights they need. Datum and DataWallet only focus on few objective channels (mostly social media) and neglect subjective opinions and consumer profiling. Only the combination of objective and subjective data and a precise consumer profile makes personal data valuable!  Hope this helps ð

Author: iamgekko
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: Hello ,I know there are also other tokens out there with the idea of data monetization. First of all this is important because it proves that there actually is a market for something like this. 1. A very important fact is that Opiria already has a working product, with existing customers and real revenue. We are very happy to have big corporations such as Mercedes, BMW, Audi, Volkswagen, GM - just to name some of them - as our customers. This clearly separates us from all others out there who just have an idea but not yet a working product with real customers.  2. In addition to that we are collecting personal data from more channels than all other projects. They are mostly limited to one single channels such as URLs or parsing information from messaging services. We are able to collect data from many different channels such as for example web browsing behavior, smartphone usage, online purchases, data from wearables and smart devices. In addition to that we have technology in place that allows us to understand what consumers are actually looking at when they browse the internet and what emotions this creates. This is hugely valuable for companies because it allows them to understand for example if a new advertisement video is seen and if consumers like it or not. Besides this so called objective data companies can also survey their consumers and receive subjective feedback from them. This can be for example how they like an existing product or service or how future version of those products or services shall be designed.

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: PDATAâs trading of personal data is based on the blockchain. Blockchains were built to function in a âtrustlessâ environment in which people can transact directly with one another without needing to trust any middleman in the ecosystem. The blockchain technology and the PDATA platform ensure following (these are also GDPR requirements): 1.     The consumer owns the personal data and has full control over it. 2.     Personal data never leaves the consumer in an unencrypted format and only the consumer holds the key to decrypt it. 3.     Personal data can only be transferred to a company with the consumerâs consent. In addition to that the consumer knows exactly who gets the data and for what purpose. 4.     The trading of personal data is fully transparent and traceable on the blockchain whereby the anonymity of the trading parties is completely protected.  Please watch the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKY0J6omPvA&t=15s

Author: kieran_84
Title: [ANN] PDATA - REVOLUTIONIZING BROKERAGE OF PERSONAL DATA
Body: We already have a working product with existing renowned customers such as Mercedes, BMW, Audi and GM. The platform we propose is already in use with all clients, minus the blockchain element. In addition to that our platform is designed to be fully compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation. In contrast to that Datum and DataWallet donÂ´t have a customer base and a working product.  Opiria is the first and only platform that brings together detailed consumer profiling, subjective feedback & opinions from consumers and data from many important objective channels (e.g. web browsing, eye tracking, emotions, data from wearables and smart devices, smartphone usage, online shopping and more). This approach provides companies with the data and insights they need. Datum and DataWallet only focus on few objective channels (mostly social media) and neglect subjective opinions and consumer profiling.
